poem:
Title: Struggle in Silence

Maggie, the playwright poor,
On her scooter, past pleasures lore,
Gave it away, a financial regret,
A friend in need, a promise yet.
Life's a bar in Eddie's trust,
An inheritance rusting in the dust.
Scribe and sorrow in unity walk,
Unseen struggles in silence talk,
Life's a stage, and we're mere cast,
In tales of present, shaped by past.
